The last thing that made me happy cry was this last Sunday. It's a long but AMAZING story.
There is a women in our church congregation who's health has been deteriorating due to Lupus. For the last couple years. I think, she has been on dialysis because she is in need of a new kidney. In California the waiting list for a new kidney is extremely long as well as being a grueling process.
Well another woman in our congregation felt led to test for being a match because many years ago she witnessed her brother go through the same thing without success. They found out that she is a match (which is huge, in and of it self) and she went through about 6 months of tests to determine if she could go through the procedure and give her kidney to the women in need.
She was a match and she was able to give her her kidney so on Sunday as a congregation, who isn't able to gather because of COVID sadly, we all "surrounded" the 2 ladies as they sat in their separate cars out in the parking lot and we formed a large socially distant circle around them and prayed.
I know there are many who may not believe in God and this might be a bold thing to say but the fact that these 2 ladies who have been attending the same church were somehow a perfect match and they were able to still do the surgery through all that has been going on right now and that they were able to stay healthy enough to do the surgery... all of these things coming together at this moment is a miracle. An actual real life miracle, and well I can tell you I most definitely wasn't they only one crying from happiness on Sunday.
Both ladies made it through the surgery as of Monday and they seem to be doing well but are still recovering and will be for a while.
